description: It is collection of entities, you should generate something from sub-entities

variants.description: A comet - harbringer of doom or great change - streaks slowly across thesky
A great deluge has drowned the lowlands, leaving may settlements underwater
A terrible plague sweeps the land, decimating centers of population.
A new mineral has been discovered which, when properly processed, extends life.
Long ago, terrible earthquakes created great chasms that divide the lands.
Islands drift across the sky, accessible only by winged or wizardly means.
The moon broke and fell to earth in pieces, leading to war over its celestial treasures.
The civilized lands are experiencing a golden age of chivalry.
A great war has broken out between the sorcerer-lords
A demon-lord has wrested control of one of the great kingdoms.
A demigod rules the most populous city.
Outlander tribes, united under a new war chief, and have begun raiding in force.
A messianic figure has appeared in the outlands, promising immortality for all
An ancient order protects the civilized world from the forces of chaos.
Magical portals connect the great cities of the world.
Due to recent events, tensions between certain species have reached a boiling point.
An enigmatic ruler demands the annual sacrifice of child from each community.
The first folk left long ago, passing beyond the nether-lands, but now they return.
The great merchant cities are ascendant.
Arcane tempests of unknown origin sweep across the land.
The world is pocked by zones, large and small, where magic does not work at all
Planar rifts have begun to open in unexpected places.
The practice of unsanctioned magic is a criminal offense in most civilized settlements.
The spirits of departed ancestors have begun to appear with increasing frequency.
The dead will always rise unless appropriate precautions are taken.
A great conclave of witches is imminent, at which a new leader will be chosen.
There is a great arcane university is where all “legitimate” magic-users learn their art.
Strange crystals have begun to sprout and spread, but only under certain conditions.
An unknown force is replacing people with changelings
The rulers of old have begun to rise from their tombs.
A vast empire seeks to expand further.
A dominant religion persecutes sages and philosophers as enemies of the church.
Primordial mystery-cults wage a secret war for the fate of the free lands
Ancient constructs have begun to animate and emerge from their subterranean vaults.
A great lord is dying; without a strong leader, their realm has fallen to turmoil
An alchemical concoction with explosive properties is changing the face of warfare.
Dark forces gather in the outlands, mustered under the banner of some fell master
Open war has broken out between two dominant and opposing religions.
One of the civilized, non-human cultures has recently chosen to isolate itself.
The magical beacons that ward off the forces of darkness have begun to fail
Feuds between the gods are fought out by titans in the mundane world.
An interculutural council of honorable rulers strives to maintain peace
A dominant religious order has declared one of the great rulers a heretic.
The towering war-suits of the ancients litter the wilderness.
In the wake of a great cataclysm, the survivors have begun to rebuild society.
Periodic meteor showers bring madness and mutation from beyond the stars.
Magic spells can only be cast by use of a certain gemstone.
The civilized species have at last united, but forgiveness does not come easily to all.
The undead are commonly exploited for economic or strategic gain.
Winter has not passed as it should have; the frost-roots are spreading.

dictionaries.description: An inconvenience or complication that might deplete resources, cause ability damage, or cause problems within the party.

variants.description: Examples: broken hand/foot/limb, conscussion, etc.
Examples: exposure, frostbite, heatstroke, etc.
Examples: twisted ankle, sprain, dizziness, etc.
Examples: physical strain causes 1d4/1d6/1d8 ability damage
Examples: gear lost/damaged, etc.
Examples: loss of food/water to spoilage, vermin, carelessness, etc.
Examples: tension, misunderstanding, argument, etc.
Examples: distracting/annoying insects, pests, people, etc.

dictionaries.description: An obstruction to forward progress that must be overcome or circumnavigated

variants.description: magical: roll natural obstacle, add magic type
roll natural obstacle, add element
roll natural obstacle, attach deity
Examples: barrier created by local creature/faction
Examples: cliff, escarpment, dense jungle, etc.
Examples: dense undergrowth, etc.
Examples: river, ravine, crevasse, chasm, abyss, etc.
Examples: wetland, sand dunes, deep snow, etc.

dictionaries.description: A potentially harmful problem that must be dealt with directly.

variants.description: magical: roll natural hazard, add magic type
roll natural hazard, add element
roll natural hazard, attach deity
Examples: chasm, crevasse, abyss, rift
Examples: bog, mire, tarpit, quicksand, etc.
Examples: trap created by local creature /faction
Examples: blizzard, thunderstorm, sandstorm, etc.
Examples: fire, flood, avalanche, etc.
Examples: mist, fog, murk, gloom, miasma, etc.

unaffected by damage from specific source

variants.title: Sick/dying
variants.description: Perhaps with TASK or ITEM to impart.
Going after PC or NPC, to eliminate them or take an ITEM from them.
Capturing warm bodies for slavery/ransom/human sacrifice.
Looking for a fight because they bored/vengeful/frustrated/drunk etc.
Being attacked/robbed/exploited/abducted by another NPC
Hungry/heartbroken/anxious. May offer a TASK to ameliorate condition.
Perceives PC as ally/enemy, and/or that they possess an important ITEM.
Escaping harm/imprisonment/servitude.
Begs/demands help with TASK, with little or nothing to offer in return.
Looking for the right sort to join the watch/army/gang/cult.
Seeking skilled individuals for an ongoing TASK.
Will grant a specific bounty upon proven completion of a TASK.
